profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

bioghist.p: Hugo Albert Rennert (1858-1927) was a professor of Romanic languages and literature at the University of Pennsylvania. His best known book was The Life of Lope de Vega, 1562-1635 (1904).

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence to and manuscripts collected by Rennert. Most of the correspondence, 1892-1920, is from James Fitzmaurice Kelly, the Romance Languages editor of the Modern Language Review. There are also a number of letters (in French) from R. Foulche-Delbosc, the editor of the French journal Revue Hispanique. Manuscripts include transcriptions of older theatrical and poetic texts, in Spanish and Italian including Poema Sacro di Pietro Bescape, El Teatro de Valencia, by Luis Lamarca, 1840, and De la Memoria de Don Jose Antonio de Armona Corregidor de Madrid. There are also includes several plans of the Teatro de la Cruz, Madrid.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
